content:
Anderson .Paak & The Free Nationals and Tove Lo are both incredible performers who are sure to deliver high-energy shows.

**Navigating the Festival Grounds:**

* **Festival Map:** Take a few minutes to study the festival map, which will be available on the Outside Lands website and mobile app. Familiarize yourself with the stage locations, food and drink vendors, and amenities like restrooms and water refill stations.
* **Get Familiar with the Layout:** The festival grounds are divided into several areas, including the main stages (Lands End, Twin Peaks, and Sutro), the Panhandle, and the GastroMagic area. Take some time to explore the layout and get a sense of where everything is located.
* **Use the Festival App:** The official Outside Lands app will provide you with a map, schedule, and important updates throughout the festival. You can also use it to customize your schedule and receive notifications when your favorite artists are about to take the stage.

**Navigating the Crowds:**

* **Arrive Early:** Get to the festival grounds early to avoid long lines and crowds. You can also catch some of the earlier acts and get a good spot for the more popular performances.
* **Plan Your Day:** Prioritize the acts you want to see and plan your day accordingly. Make sure to leave some buffer time to account for crowds and travel time between stages.
* **Know the Peak Hours:** Peak hours tend to be between 3 pm and 6 pm, when the most popular acts are performing. Be prepared for larger crowds during this time, and consider exploring other areas of the festival or taking a break if you need some space.
* **Stay Hydrated and Fed:** Make sure to drink plenty of water and eat regularly throughout the day. This will help you stay energized and focused, even in the midst of large crowds.
* **Be Patient and Flexible:** Be prepared for crowds, long lines, and potential delays. Stay patient, and be willing to adjust your plans if needed.

**Additional Tips:**

* **Wear Comfortable Shoes:** You'll be doing a lot of walking and standing, so make sure to wear comfortable shoes that can handle the demands of the festival.
* **Bring a Portable Charger:** With all the photo taking and social media updates, your phone's battery can quickly drain. Bring a portable charger to keep your devices charged throughout the day.
* **Stay Connected:** Make sure to designate a meeting spot with your friends in case you get separated, and consider creating a group chat to stay in touch throughout the festival.

By following these tips, you'll be well-prepared to navigate the festival grounds and crowds, and make the most of your Outside Lands experience!
